de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.examples.nes

Class NesServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.AbstractPsychicServer
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.examples.nes.NesServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonListener, ClientListener, ResetListener, OnCommandListener, ExceptionListener, ClientLossListener

    public class NesServer
extends AbstractPsychicServer
    This server is designed to create NES controller input from gravity and linear acceleration data

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,NetworkDataSink> mAccPhaseDetectors
      This variable stores our acceleration phase detectors, mapped from network devices so we can easily access the one responsible for any given network device
      private java.util.PriorityQueue<ButtonConfig> mButtonConfigs
      This priority queue stores all available button configs.
      private ClientSplitter mGravitySplitter
      This client splitter makes sure that gravity data is only sent to the correct pipeline
      private ClientSplitter mLinearAccelerationSplitter
      This client splitter makes sure that linear acceleration data is only sent to the correct pipeline
      private java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,SteeringWheel> mSteeringWheels
      This variable stores our steering wheels, mapped from network devices so we can easily access the correct one.
      private int PLAYER_NUM_NOTIFICATION_ID
      This value represents an id number which is used by the Android NotificationManager to identify notifications

    • Field Detail

      • mSteeringWheels

        private java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,SteeringWheel> mSteeringWheels
        This variable stores our steering wheels, mapped from network devices so we can easily access the correct one.

      • mAccPhaseDetectors

        private java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,NetworkDataSink> mAccPhaseDetectors
        This variable stores our acceleration phase detectors, mapped from network devices so we can easily access the one responsible for any given network device

      • mButtonConfigs

        private java.util.PriorityQueue<ButtonConfig> mButtonConfigs
        This priority queue stores all available button configs. they will get taken out as more clients connect, and stored back when clients are removed. Queue is automatically sorted by playerID stored in ButtonConfig

      • mLinearAccelerationSplitter

        private ClientSplitter mLinearAccelerationSplitter
        This client splitter makes sure that linear acceleration data is only sent to the correct pipeline

      • mGravitySplitter

        private ClientSplitter mGravitySplitter
        This client splitter makes sure that gravity data is only sent to the correct pipeline

      • PLAYER_NUM_NOTIFICATION_ID

        private final int PLAYER_NUM_NOTIFICATION_ID
        This value represents an id number which is used by the Android NotificationManager to identify notifications
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • NesServer

        public NesServer(@Nullable
                 java.lang.String serverName)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.awt.AWTException
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until AbstractPsychicServer.start() is called.
        Parameters:
        serverName - if not null, this name will be used. otherwise, the devices hostname is used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an issue with the phone communication arose
        java.awt.AWTException - if your device does not support javas Robot input

    • Method Detail

      • loadButtonMappings

        private void loadButtonMappings()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads all available button mappings from ../keys.properties
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be found

      • getAccelerationPhaseDetection

        private NetworkDataSink getAccelerationPhaseDetection(SteeringWheel wheel)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Create a pipeline that filters linear acceleration data so that the acceleration phase detection system can correctly recognize up/down events
        Parameters:
        wheel - the SteeringWheel getting the up/down events
        Returns:
        a NetworkDataSink representing the beginning of the AccelerationPhaseDetection pipeline
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the data sink could not be registered

      • onException

        public void onException(java.lang.Object origin,
                        java.lang.Exception exception,
                        java.lang.String info)
        Called when an exception cannot be gracefully handled.
        Parameters:
        origin - the instance (or, if it is a hidden instance, the known parent) that produced the exception
        exception - the exception that was thrown
        info - additional information to help identify the problem

      • acceptClient

        public boolean acceptClient(NetworkDevice newClient)
        Check whether a new client should be accepted
        Parameters:
        newClient - the new clients identification
        Returns:
        true if the client should be accepted, false otherwise
